result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Graves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid within 90 days or penalty of 6 days Huber for non-payment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher L Graves in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 
Sentence of:
FINE:  $631.00
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:    to be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 6 days in Huber 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Christopher L Graves did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements regarding the nonappearance of his client and requests a plea date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Christopher L Graves in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motions to be filed by the end of next week.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Christopher L Graves in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Christopher L Graves in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery. Defense requests a new date due to the defendant being enrolled in treatment.  Hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Christopher L Graves in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Christopher L Graves in court with attorney Mark Powers for Matthew Huppertz.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.
